item.title: Samsung Galaxy S III Supports Verizon 4G LTE
item.description:
The Samsung Galaxy S III for Verizon Wireless is a top-of-the-line smartphone with cutting-edge technology for both features and speed. This model continues the Galaxy series’ tradition of innovation. This Android smartphone uses the Google Operating System 4.0 “Ice Cream Sandwich” and features a 4.8-inch HD Super AMOLED display. With 1280 x 720 pixels, the screen displays sharp, vibrant images and text. The curved design helps prevent scratches, even when the phone is face down...

item.title: Cell Phone Plans With Aircards
item.description:
Wireless modem aircards liberate you from the constraints of WiFi hotspots, transforming your laptop into a truly mobile computer. But how do they work, and what kind of service plans are necessary? Essentially, an aircard functions as a specialized two-way radio, transmitting and receiving digital computer data instead of voice calls. While they might resemble them, aircards don’t operate on cell phone networks. Currently, the majority adhere to either EVDO (Sprint and Verizon Wireless) or EDGE and HSPA (AT&T and T-Mobile) standards for cellular broadband...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/cell-phone-plans-with-aircards/

item.title: You Pay Too Much For Phone Service
item.description:
A recent study reveals that a majority of cellphone and landline users spend more than they should on their phone services, often significantly exceeding reasonable costs. This overpayment can be as high as $3 per minute for landlines and $3 overall for cell phones. While it’s easy to assume this doesn’t apply to you, it’s worth examining your phone usage closely. Have you analyzed your phone bills recently? The results might surprise you...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/you-pay-too-much-for-phone-service/
